doc.previous: A measure can be extended to a complete one by considering the algebra of subsets Y which differ by a negligible set from a measurable set X that is such that the symmetric difference of X and Y is contained in a null set One defines Y to equal X
doc.after: That is we define the sum of the ri to be the supremum of all the sums of finitely many of them
